top_categories.workout_context: Haute Route Gravel’s 350-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Haute Route Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Haute Route Gravel’s 30,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Haute Route Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Every session at Haute Route Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Haute Route Gravel’s european alpine gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 350 miles, Haute Route Gravel rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Haute Route Gravel’s european alps, multi-stage demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Haute Route Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Haute Route Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Haute Route Gravel’s european alpine gravel delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Haute Route Gravel’s 30,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 350 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 350 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Haute Route Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Haute Route Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on european alpine gravel to build confidence. Expect: european alps, multi-stage, commercial event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Over Under, and Mixed Climbing to prepare you for 350 miles of european alpine gravel in Various Europe.
